docs.lead_paragraph: KAFB EL BATTIKH, U.A.R. FOR 50 centuries or more the majestic Nile has sustained Egypt, throbbing like lifeblood through the land of the Pharoahs before spending itself in one final muddy thrust into the shining blue Mediterranean. Each year its flood, with precious silt from the African highlands, has seeped into the cracked dry earth of Egypt in a magnificent act of rejuvenation.

headline.main: Watermelon Village Races Against Time; Watermelon Village "Virtually no important event escapes Government attention"
